msContents.summary: F. i v(erso): record of an event on Nahase 3. F. iir: Asmat prayer against hail and lightning, ጸሎተ፡ በረድ፡ ወመብረቅ። F. ii v: Asmat prayer for protection. F. iii r-iv r: Prayer to God, “For the Sake of the Honor and Covenant of Our Lady, Virgin Mary,” በእንተ፡ ዕበያ፡ ወክብራ፡ ወኪዳና፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ድንግል፡ ; Ff. iv r-v: Hymn to Mary, “I Prostrate Before You,” እሰግድ፡ ለኪ፡. Répertoire 336/338. F. v r: record of an event on Nahase 3, 1916, referring to Grazmač and Qängazmač. F-125v: Harp of Praise, Arganonä Wǝddase, አርጋኖነ፡ ውዳሴ፡, arranged for the days of the week. Pontus Leander, `Arganona Ueddase nach Handschriften in Uppsala, Berlin, Tübingen und Frankfurt a. M. Göteborgs Högskolas Årsskrift 28.3 (Leipzig 1922). Monday (), Tuesday (), Wednesday (), F-v: One Miracle of Mary.How the Virgin delivered from devils the soul of a scribe who was engaged in writing a copy of the Book of her Miracles. This scribe had a brother who had sinned, but not knowing him they seized the innocent man and tried to carry him off to hell (Budge, XVIII; Princeton Ethiopic MS 41, f–67v; EMDL 681, f) Thursday (), Friday (), Saturday (106r), Sunday (). A Miracle of Mary, incomplete at the end. . Record in a later hand, complete with fingerprint.
